graphicslib3D
Class ControlMesh

java.lang.Object
  graphicslib3D.ControlMesh
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ControlMesh
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class defines a 4x4 array of "control points" -- Point3D objects which represent the control points for a cubic Bezier surface. Elements of the ControlMesh may be accessed individually by row/column index; indices start at zero (and hence have an allowable range of 0..3).

See Also:
Serialized Form

          Creates a control point array with default control point values.

Constructor Detail

ControlMesh

public ControlMesh()
Creates a control point array with default control point values.

Method Detail

elementAt

public mathlib3D.Point3D elementAt(int row,
                                   int col)
Returns a reference to the point at the specified row and column in the ControlMesh. Row and column indexes begin with zero. The value returned is a copy of the actual Point3D object stored at the specified row and column.

getRow

public java.util.Vector getRow(int row)
Returns a Vector containing references to the points in the specified row of the ControlMesh. Row indexes begin at zero. The returned Vector contains Point3D objects which are copies of the actual points in the array.

getColumn

public java.util.Vector getColumn(int col)
Returns a Vector containing references to the points in the specified column of the ControlMesh. Column indexes begin at zero. The returned Vector contains Point3D objects which are copies of the actual points in the array.

getArray

public mathlib3D.Point3D[][] getArray()
Returns a 4x4 array of Point3D objects. The Point3Ds in the returned arrays are copies of the Point3D objects contained in this ControlMesh.

addElement

public void addElement(mathlib3D.Point3D thePoint,
                       int row,
                       int col)
Replaces an existing point in this ControlMesh. The specified point is added to the ControlMesh at the specified row and column, replacing the old point there. Row and column indexes start at zero.

setArray

public void setArray(mathlib3D.Point3D[][] theNewArray)
Replaces the data in this ControlMesh with the specified array. The new array should be a 4x4 matrix of Point3D objects defining the new surface.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a formatted representation of the Point3D values in this ControlMesh.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
